post.content:
Word of the Day for Sunday September 8, 2002: xenophobia \ZEN-uh-FOE-bee-uh\, noun: Fear or hatred of strangers, people from other countries, or of anything that is strange or foreign.
In Europe today, it is xenophobia and the political manipulation of fear of foreigners that pose the greatest threat to democracy, or at least to the quality of democracy. --Kofi Annan, "Democracy: An international issue," UN Chronicle, June-August, 2001
외국인공포증과 이를 조장하는 정치요소로 인해 현대 유럽의 민주주의 혹은 최소한 그것의 품격이 위협을 당하고 있다.
post.title: xenophobia
